If at time \\( t_1 \\), an intervention using another function \\( h(z) = e^{i\\phi}z \\) is applied, will the final state \\( z(T) \\) for T > t_1 be independent of the phase changes introduced by \\( g(z) \\) and \\( h(z) \\)?
Explanation: The application of \\( h(z) \\) at \\( t_1 \\) further complicates the dependency of the final state on both the initial transformation by \\( g(z) \\) and the intervention \\( h(z) \\). The final state \\( z(T) \\) will reflect the cumulative effect of these transformations, resulting in a state dependent on both the respective phase shifts.
